Welcome
Welcome to Star Wars: The Old Republic. Your epic story in the Star Wars universe has just begun. These tutorials will help guide you. May the Force be with you!
Movement
You can move your character by pressing the A, S, W and D keys. To look around, hold the left mouse button and move the mouse.
Missions
You have a mission. In order to find the objective of your mission, open your map. A flashing icon should show you where you need to go.
Mission Log
You can keep track of your mission objectives through the mission log accessed through the mission icon at the top of your screen. Your missions are also tracked on the right-hand side of the screen.
Class Story Areas (Solo)

These areas are where many important events in your class story take place. A Class Story area can be identified by moving the mouse over its entrance. If the entrance barrier is green, you can enter the story area. If the entrance barrier is red, you cannot enter the story area.
Group Story Areas

A Group Story area can be identified by moving the mouse over its entrance. If the entrance barrier is green, you can enter the story area. If the entrance barrier is red, you cannot enter the story area.
Class Story Areas (Multiplayer)

You can allow group members of your same class into your Class Story area by changing a preference. This preference, called Allow access to same-class story areas, is in the Social tab of the Preference window.
Note: Group members of your same class may be able to enter your Class Story area; however, their missions will not progress while they are in your Class Story area.
Group Story Areas (Multiplayer)

A Group Story area can be identified by moving the mouse over its entrance. If the entrance barrier is green, your group can enter the story area. If the entrance barrier is red, your group cannot enter the story area.
Attacking Enemies

To engage enemies in battle, left-click on them to target them. Move into attack range. You will know you are in attack range when one or more of the abilities on your Quickbar lights up. Then left-click an ability on the Quickbar. The Quickbar is located at the bottom of your screen.
Using Abilities

Any time you want to view your abilities, left-click on the Abilities button in the upper part of your screen to open your Abilities panel. To move the ability to your Quickbar, left-click and drag the ability to a location on the Quickbar.
Player and Enemy Status

Your health bar is the red bar located in the lower left part of your screen. When your health reaches zero, you will be defeated. Your ability resource bar is below your health bar. Enemies also have health bars located in the lower right part of your screen.
Looting

When you defeat an enemy, its defeated body will glow if it has loot. Right-click your enemy's defeated body to open its Loot window. Then, right-click on any items in the Loot window to add them to your inventory.
Opening Your Inventory

You have picked up an item. It is now in your inventory. You can left-click on the Inventory button in the upper part of your screen to open the Inventory panel. Move the mouse over the acquired item to learn more about it.
Equipping Items

To equip an item, right-click or double left-click on the item in your inventory. To view your equipped item, click on the Character Sheet button in the upper part of your screen to open the Character Sheet panel.
Using Items
You can use some of the items in your inventory. Right-click on an item to use it. You can also drag these items to your Quickbar and use them without opening your inventory.
Experience Points (XP)

Experience Points (or XP) are acquired by defeating enemies and completing missions. When you have acquired enough XP, you will gain another level.
Leveling up allows you to become more powerful, acquire more abilities and take on greater challenges. You must find a trainer to learn new abilities.
Leveling Up

Congratulations! You have reached a new level! Your health and some of your core attributes have been increased, and you should have an easier time fighting higher level enemies. Also, you should seek out a class trainer to learn new abilities.
Mission Completed

Congratulations! You have completed a mission. Mission givers will reward you with experience and often will give you credits and items as well. Right-click on mission givers to interact with them and claim your reward.
Unavailable Missions
If a mission giver has a gray mission offer symbol over its head that means it offers a mission too high for your current level. Return to this mission giver once you have reached a higher level.
Vendors
You have items to sell. In order to sell your items you must find a vendor. Vendors are represented by a credit icon on your map.
Inventory Almost Full

Your inventory is almost full. To free up inventory space, you can sell items you have acquired. Locate a vendor and right-click on him. Then, right-click on any items in your inventory you would like to sell.
Inventory Full

Your inventory is full. You can either sell items to vendors, or you can pay credits to expand your Inventory Module by left-clicking the Expand Inventory Module button located in the center of your Inventory panel.
Chatting

To chat, press the ENTER key, type your text, and your text will appear in the chat box in the top left of your screen. Press ENTER again to display your text. For more chat options, click the chat button to the left of the Chat window.
Players and Grouping

To group, all you need to do is to right-click on another player. You will be given the option to send them a group invite. If they accept, you will be able to chat with them using Group chat. To find players to group with, mark yourself as Looking For Group using the Who panel.
Quick Travel

Quick Travel allows you to transport from your current location to a quick travel point. You can unlock a quick travel point by right-clicking on a Quick Travel Point terminal.
You automatically unlock a quick travel point when you enter a new planet. Also, there's a cooldown for using the Quick Travel ability.
Appraising Enemy Difficulty

You have targeted a challenging enemy. Challenge ratings range from weakest to strongest: Weak, Standard, Strong, Elite and Boss.
More challenging enemies may require you to group with others to defeat them. Mousing over enemies is a quick way to appraise them in a hurry.
Defeated

You have been defeated. You can be revived by either activating a medical probe or by returning to the nearest medical center. Nearby players can also revive your character if they are not in combat mode.
Class Trainers
You can learn new abilities from your class trainer. Right-click on your class trainer to interact with them. Note: Training is expensive. Be sure to save some credits for training when you level up!
Specialty Goods
You have acquired a data crystal. These crystals contain data of lost knowledge. They can be traded to Data Crystal and Specialty vendors for specialty goods.
Companions

You have gained a companion! These characters complement your strengths and weaknesses and provide company for the epic journey you will inevitably undertake. Companions have combat abilities that can be toggled on and off by right-clicking on an ability next to their portrait in the lower left corner of the screen.
Left-click on the + sign to the far right of their portrait to display the Companion Quickbar located below your Quickbars.
Advanced Class Training

Now that you've reached level 10, you can choose an Advanced Class. Advanced Classes are specialized careers that will not only make you more distinct and powerful, but will also help further define your role. Left-click on the Disciplines button in the upper part of your screen to open the Disciplines panel and make your selection between two options based on your character's current class.
Disciplines

Disciplines provide access to various special abilities (such as the ability to dual-wield lightsabers, wear heavy armor) and allows you to customize how your character plays during combat. At certain levels during your progression you will get new abilities and skills that grant special bonuses to exisitng abilities you are already using within your Discipline. In addition, you can select Utility Skills from a pool of possible choices, allowing your character to play exactly how you want it while keeping your main role strength intact.
Left-click on the Disciplines button in the upper part of your screen to open the Disciplines panel.
Crew Skill Trainers

Crew Skills allow you to assign your crew of companions to gather resources, craft useful and valuable items, and even undertake their own missions, bringing you a variety of benefits and rewards. The world map and minimap will show you where nearby Crew Skill trainers are located.
Right-clicking on a Crew Skill trainer will grant you a Codex entry that tells you more about the Crew Skill available to train. To manage your crew of companions, left-click on the Crew Window button in the upper part of your screen.
PvP Warzone Queue

At level 10, you can participate in player versus player Warzones. Left-click the PvP Warzone button located in the lower right part of the screen and select the Warzones Icon. Then select to Queue Solo or Queue Group to be added to the warzone queue.
Once enough players are queued up, you will receive a popup allowing you to enter the battle.
Gathering Resources

You are near a gathering resource node, which you can harvest if you have the proper skill. You can instruct your companion to gather the node by holding down the SHIFT key and right-clicking on the node, or you can gather the resource node yourself by right-clicking on it. Nearby gathering resource nodes are also visible on the world map and minimap.
You can also gather resources by sending your companions on missions. Note: Mission costs can be expensive. Be sure to save some credits!
Crafting Exceptional Items

You have crafted an item! There is a chance that when you craft an item it will be of exceptional quality. Exceptional quality items will be labeled with a special prefix and will possess an Augment slot. Augments make crafted items more powerful and can be acquired by sending your companions on Slicing missions. Note: You can queue up to 5 crafting tasks for a companion.
Crafting Droids and Workstations

You have learned a crafting skill. Once you acquire a ship, you will be granted access to a Crafting Droid companion and a crafting workstation (required for higher level crafting). Your ship's cargo hold can also be used to store crafting materials. If your inventory lacks the required materials to craft an item, companions can use the stored materials from the ship's cargo hold.
Reverse Engineering Crafted Items

You can reverse engineer most items that you craft and some items that you find in the world. Reverse engineering will return you some of the materials needed to craft that item, as well as offer a chance to make a better version of that item.
To reverse engineer an item, open your Inventory panel, left-click on the Reverse Engineering button and then right-click on the item.
Galaxy Map

You have acquired your starship! You may travel to other worlds by right-clicking on the Galaxy Map object in your ship's cockpit and selecting your destination. Make sure you have credits for the fuel cost.
Piloting Speeders

You have acquired a Speeder bike! Left-click on the Abilities button in the upper part of your screen to open your Abilities panel. Then left-click on the Vehicles tab. You can also left-click and drag your Speeder bike to move it to your Quickbar.
Space Combat Movement
As you move your mouse around the screen, your ship will fly toward your cursor. Press the SPACEBAR to barrel roll.
Space Combat Blasters
You can fire your starship blasters at the target under your cursor by left-clicking. Hold down the left mouse button to fire continuously.
Space Combat Missiles
Hold down the right mouse button and select 1 to 4 targets by dragging the mouse over them. When you release the right mouse button, a missile will be fired at each target.
Influence

Making decisions in a conversation can modify your companion's influence for you. Make decisions they agree with, and their opinion of you will increase. Note that companions rarely think in terms of "Dark Side" and "Light Side," but instead value concepts like honor, avarice or mischief.
Read your companions' Codex entries to see what exactly they might value. Note: Influence improves a companion's mission and crafting results as well as reduces the amount of time required for them to perform crew skill tasks.
Gifts

Some items will increase your currently selected companion's influence when you use them. Better gifts give greater rewards. Note that different companions value different kinds of gifts, so be sure to pay attention to their reactions.
Taking Cover
You can take cover from enemy blaster fire by moving behind a solid object and using the Cover ability (default key: F) on your quickbar.
Respecialization

If you make a mistake choosing a Discipline, you can choose to abandon it by interacting with the Skill Mentor. You can find the Skill Mentor aboard your Fleet's space station. Abandoning your Discipline will allow you to choose a new one from the three your Advanced Class has available. Note that the cost of doing so increases each time you do so.
Damaged Items

You may have noticed an indicator on your screen denoting that one of your items is very damaged and nearly destroyed. Items take damage from wear and tear in combat and are damaged greatly when you are defeated in combat.
Items that are fully destroyed offer no benefit to the character, so you should find a vendor to repair these items as soon as it is convenient.
Destroyed Items
One of your items has been destroyed, and you can no longer gain the benefits of equipping that item. It is recommended you find a vendor and repair it as quickly as possible.
Light Side/Dark Side

Some conversation responses will reward the player with Light Side or Dark Side points. Your conversation choices can change your Light Side/Dark Side levels. You can check your Light Side/Dark Side level by opening the Character Sheet panel.
Some items you find in the world have level requirements (such as Light Side III) before they can be used. These items can often be purchased at vendors throughout the game.
Equipping Your Companion

You can equip gear onto your companion! Do so by selecting the Companion tab on your Character Sheet, and then equipping gear as usual. Note that your companions' skills may limit which gear they can equip.
Social Points

You can earn social points by joining missions and conversations with other players. You can win more social points by winning (and even losing) conversation rolls. You can view your social score on your Character Sheet.
Some items you find in the world have level requirements (such as Social II) before they can be used. These items can often be purchased at vendors throughout the game.
Holocalls

You have to use your holocommunicator to complete your current mission. Find a safe location, then click on the Holocall button below to initiate that conversation. Holocalls are usually better answered sooner rather than later.
Mission Items

You have a mission that requires you to use an item in your inventory to progress. All mission items can be found in the Mission Items tab of your Inventory panel.
To use a mission item, select a target and right-click the item in your inventory. You can also drag the item to your Quickbar and click the icon or use the hotkey.
Item Modifications

You have acquired an item modification. You can use this to improve one of your existing items; however, item modifications can only fit into compatible slots. If an item is modifiable, you can CTRL + right-click on it to open its Modification window.
Speaking with Companions

Your companion wants to speak to you in private. Sometimes, he or she will be satisfied talking with you in a cantina, but more frequently, you will need the privacy of your own ship. Mouse over the icon on your companion's portrait for more information.
Selling Junk

Your inventory is full. However, your companion can help you with that. Right-click on his or her portrait and choose Sell Junk, and your companion will go off and sell all gray-quality items in your inventory.
Start Saving!

When you reach level 25, you will be able to learn how to pilot Speeder bikes and other ground vehicles. You might want to start saving your credits now--the cost to learn vehicle piloting is expensive.
PvP Warzone Ready
A warzone is now ready for you. Left-click ENTER Now to be transported to the battle.
PvP Warzones

You have entered a player versus player warzone! Warzones are instanced battles between teams of players. Watch the Warzone UI at the upper right part of the screen to see the status of your objectives.
PvP Valor Ranks
You have gained a valor rank! Valor ranks display your experience in PvP combat and unlock special rewards based on your progress. You can view your current valor rank from the Character Sheet panel.
PvP Flag

You are flagged for PvP! You can now attack and be attacked by other players who are also flagged for PvP. Your PvP flag will wear off after 5 minutes in PvP-safe areas.
If you are defeated by another player, you will become immune to PvP and unable to reactivate your PvP flag for 10 minutes.
Open World PvP

You have entered a player versus player area! This area contains objectives for both factions to achieve. Fight against opposing faction players and accomplish your faction's objectives while preventing the enemy from accomplishing theirs.
Datacrons
Many datacrons remain hidden throughout the known worlds. These ancient artifacts enhance those who activate them.
Taxis
Taxis allow you to quickly travel between locations. Use a taxi by right-clicking a Transport Service droid and selecting your destination. Make sure you have enough credits for the fare.
Elevators
Some elevators will require you to right-click a nearby console to use it. Other elevators are always moving, pausing only for a few seconds to let you onto its lift platform.
Dangerous Environments

Blazing infernos, toxic lakes, blistering sand dunes, freezing tundras and falling long distances can harm you if you're not careful. When faced with such hazards, the safest thing to do is back up the way you came until you are out of danger.
Fleet Commendations
Ships can be improved with upgrades purchased from Starship Sales and Service vendors. These ship upgrades can only be purchased with fleet commendations and cannot be purchased with credits.
Starship Sales and Service Vendors
Starship Sales and Service vendors can be found among large groups of vendors, typically near each planet's entry point. Use fleet commendations to buy upgrades and improve your ship.
Ship Upgrades

To add an upgrade to your ship, open your Character Sheet panel and left-click the Ship tab. Then open your Inventory panel and drag the upgrade into the appropriate upgrade location in the Ship tab.
If your upgrades have special abilities, they can be used by clicking their icons in your ship's Quickbar on the lower left corner of your screen.
Fleet Command Console
While in your ship's cockpit, right-click on the Fleet Command Console to learn if your contact has more space missions for you.
Locating Space Missions

While in your ship's cockpit, use the galaxy map to locate any available space missions. While viewing a mission's objectives, you can choose to start the mission by left-clicking the Travel Now button.
Proton Torpedoes
To fire a proton torpedo, target a critical point on an enemy and hold down the right mouse button for a few seconds. Once the proton torpedo has locked on, release the mouse button to launch it.
Bonus Objectives
Bonus objectives are often given while doing a mission. You do not have to complete a bonus objective in order to complete your primary goals, but it's a great way to get additional experience.
Heroic Missions

Heroic missions can be more challenging than one player can handle alone. For many heroic missions, you'll need to call in a friend or two to help. Some heroic missions will need a full group of four players in order to succeed.
Maps

You can track current mission objectives on your world map. Access your world map from the planet icon on your minimap. Your mission objectives will appear on the map as animating icons. Icons for services (such as vendors and trainers) can be toggled on and off using the filter controls.
Security Chests
Security Chests are hidden throughout various planets. They can contain valuable items and supplies.
Codex

You have received a Codex entry in your mission log. Codex entries are acquired by meeting persons of note, training Crew Skills, receiving titles, exploring planets and defeating powerful enemies.
To view your Codex entries, left-click on the Mission Log button in the upper part of your screen then left-click the Codex tab.
Mail

You have clicked on a mailbox. Mailboxes allow players to send and receive in-game mail and items. You can also send mail to one of your other characters. However, you cannot send or receive in-game mail or items to player characters of opposite factions.
Galactic Market Kiosks
You have clicked on a galactic market kiosk. These kiosks allow you to buy and sell items to and from other players.
Flashpoint Missions

Flashpoints are action-packed, story-driven adventures that test a group of players to their limits, putting them up against difficult foes in volatile situations.
Flashpoint missions take place in private story areas and most are balanced for a full group of four players.
Flashpoint Instances

Flashpoint instances will last for as long as the group remains inside. If all players leave the flashpoint, they can return for one hour without losing progress; after an hour, all progress through the flashpoint will be lost. You may leave a Flashpoint at any time by left-clicking the Exit Area button above your minimap.
Instance Ownership
Instances are always owned by the current group leader. Kicking any players from the group will remove them from the instance after 30 seconds.
Leaving a Flashpoint
You may leave a Flashpoint at any time by left-clicking the Exit Area button above your minimap.
Operations
Operations are instanced, large-scale multiplayer challenges. Assemble a full ops group of either 8 or 16 players before embarking on an operation.
Leading an Ops Group

As leader of an ops group, you may promote assistant leads or rearrange players within the ops group. To rearrange the group, open the Operations window, left-click a player's name and drag it to the desired position.
Ops Groups
An ops group is a force of either 8 or 16 players banded together for large-scale multiplayer challenges, such as operations or warzones.
Lockouts
When your group defeats a powerful enemy or defeats a challenge in an operation, you will be locked out of that content temporarily. Check the Lockouts tab in your mission log for more information.
Difficulty Modes
You can change the difficulty mode for flashpoints and operations by changing the Difficulty Mode setting on your player portrait.
Ilum PvP Region

You have entered Western Ice Shelf. Search for the supply crates and collect munitions to destroy the turrets defending the enemy base. Take out enemy players carrying supplies before they are able to use them to destroy the turrets at your base.
Ilum PvP Supplies
You found a supply crate! These crates contain weaponry capable of damaging the defensive turrets around the enemy base. Carry the supplies to the enemy base and attack their turrets.
Ilum PvP Turrets
You are using an anti-personnel turret! These turrets fire a limited number of shots effective against enemy troops. Defend the power generators to keep enemy players from disabling your turrets.
Ilum PvP Base Destruction

You have damaged an enemy turret! Once the turrets are destroyed, allied bombers will be called in to destroy the enemy base. But beware, enemy players are also trying to destroy your base, so be prepared to defend your base at all costs.
Ilum PvP Victory
You have destroyed the enemy base and secured the area for you and your allies! The battle is done for now, but soon the enemy will repair their base and the conflict will begin again.
Ilum PvP Defeat

Enemy players have destroyed your base! Repairs to your base's turrets will be completed soon. In the meantime, secure the munitions supplies before your enemies do and prepare to begin the battle again.
Fog of War

You have surveyed your first map. Accessible exterior (and some interior) areas are indicated by light-colored hexes on your map. Walk into the center of a hex to explore the surrounding area and earn experience points. Explore all areas to survey an entire map; complete all maps to survey an entire planet.
Energy

Your energy regenerates faster at higher energy levels. As your energy decreases, so does the rate at which it recovers. To maintain a high amount of energy, use Rifle Shot regularly to allow your energy to recover.
Energy

Your energy regenerates faster at higher energy levels. As your energy decreases, so does the rate at which it recovers. To maintain a high amount of energy, use Flurry of Bolts regularly to allow your energy to recover.
Heat

Your heat dissipates faster at lower heat levels. As your heat builds, so does the time it takes to dissipate that heat. To maintain a low heat level, use Rapid Shots regularly to allow your heat to dissipate.
Energy Cells

Your energy cells regenerate faster at higher energy levels. As your energy cells deplete, so does the rate at which they regenerate. To maintain a high level of energy cells, use Hammer Shot regularly to allow your energy cells to regenerate.
Titles
You have unlocked a title! You can choose to display that title by clicking the icon next to your name on your character sheet.
Operations

You have unlocked Operations! Band together with 16 players to take on the greatest threats in the galaxy. Ops start on the fleet. To enter one, you must be in an Ops Group. Right-click on your character portrait to convert your group to an Ops Group.
Flashpoint Veteran Mode
You have unlocked Flashpoint Veteran Mode! Locate Flashpoint Veteran Mode access missions near the flashpoint entrances to conquer greater challenges and reap greater rewards.
Ilum Territorial Control PvP

You have unlocked Ilum Territorial Control PvP! Participate in the planet's ongoing PvP conflict by competing for the five battle points on the western side of Ilum. Win all five, win control for your side and reap PvP rewards.
Leaving an Operation
You may leave an Operation at any time by left-clicking the Exit Area button above your minimap.

Getting Around
Missions
Combat
Items and Inventory
Character Advancement
Teaming Up
Companions
Crew Skills
The Journey Ahead
Movement
Basic movement skills help you explore your environment.
To move forward, press the W key. To move backward, press S. To turn to the left, press A. To turn to the right, press D.
To jump, press the spacebar. To overcome some obstacles, you may need to jump while moving.

To rotate the camera, hold down one of the mouse buttons while moving the mouse.


Holding down the left mouse button while moving the mouse rotates only the camera.


Holding down the right mouse button while moving the mouse turns your character with the camera.
Missions
Completing missions advances your character's development and progresses your story.

The triangle icon over a character's head means that he or she has a mission available for you. Right-click on the character to start a conversation and learn more about the mission.

Some missions may require content access to be purchased before accepting the mission; these triangle icons will display the Cartel Coin symbol.

The are four different types of mission iconStory Missions are the core content of Star Wars: The Old Republic.

Mission Offers are additional, non-critical missions.

Exploration Missions are optional and can be enabled at the top right of your Map Screen.


Any mission can be Repeatable.

The same icons on your minimap mark the location of a character with an available mission.
Accepted missions appear in the mission tracker in the upper-right corner of the screen. The light-blue text tells you what to do next in the mission.
Class Story and Group Areas
These areas are dedicated to critical moments in specific class story and group missions.
Class Story and Group areas are identified by a red or green entrance barrier. If the barrier is green, you can enter the area. If it's red, you can't enter.

Hover your cursor over the entrance barrier to bring up a tooltip with details on what the area is reserved for.


Class Story areas for group members are blue. You can enter these areas unless you share the same class.

You can allow group members of your class into your Class Story areas by selecting that setting on the Social tab of the Preferences menu. However, their class stories will not progress while they are in your Class Story area.
World Map
You can track mission objectives and locate points of interest on your world map.
To open the world map, click on the planet icon next to your minimap.
Mission objectives and directions to objectives in other areas are marked with specific icons.
Green arrows point to area transition points and taxis to mission objectives that aren't on the current map.
Taxis
Travel quickly between locations by using the taxi transport service.
Taxi locations are indicated by the double-sided arrow icon over a transport service droid's head or on your map.

To use a taxi, right-click on the transport service droid to bring up the destination map.


To select a destination, left-click on the icon for the location you want to travel to. Each travel route charges a fee.
Taxi stations that lead to mission objectives are highlighted in green on the destination map.
Basic Combat
Hostile enemies will attack you as you approach them.
Select an enemy you want to attack by left-clicking on it. When you do, you should see his nameplate and health bar.

Use your abilities to attack the enemy. Abilities appear as icons in the quickslot bar at the bottom of your screen.


To activate an ability, left-click on the icon or press the corresponding number key.

Some abilities do not work if you are out of range. Melee-based abilities can only be used up close, and even ranged abilities have limitations.


As you deal damage, the health bar over the enemy's head drains. When the health bar is empty, the enemy is defeated.
Cover
Your class can take cover to gain a defensive advantage.
Where cover is available, you will see a green silhouette. By default, press the F key to roll into cover.

While in cover, you have strong defensive bonuses and access to additional abilities that appear in the Cover Bar of your quickslots.


As you learn new cover abilities, you may want to add them to the Cover Bar.
You can disable the Cover Bar on the User Interface tab of the Preferences menu.
Loot
Acquire new items by looting defeated enemies.
A beam of light shining from a downed enemy means that they have loot. Right-click on the body to open the loot window.
You can right-click each item in the loot window to take it. However, in most cases, it's easier to click on Take All to grab all of the items in the window.

Different-colored beams and item names correspond to item quality.


If you see a green beam, be sure to get the loot! Even if it's not useful to you, it's probably valuable and worth taking to sell later.
Inventory and Equipment
Newly acquired items are stored in your inventory.
To open the Inventory panel, left-click on the person icon on the Menu Bar and then left-click on the box icon or press the I key.

To see an item's details, hover your mouse cursor over it. To equip an item, right-click on it.


Some items might require a Free-to-Play Player to have the correct Authorization to use it.
To see your character's equipped items, open the Character Sheet panel by clicking on the person icon on the Menu Bar or pressing C.
Chatting with Other Players
Communicate with other players in the area using the Chat panel.

To type a message, press the Enter key to open the Chat panel.


Press Enter again to send the message.
To access chat options, click on the chat button in the left corner of the Chat panel or use slash commands.

You can type /say before your message to speak only with nearby players or /yell to shout across a wide area.


The /general, /trade, and /pvp channels cover the entire planet and are limited to the Origin Worlds for Free-to-Play Players until level 10.
Grouping with Other Players
Playing in a group is a great way to take on more challenging content.
To form a group, left-click on another player to target them and then left-click on the purple Invite to Group button.

If the other player accepts, you can chat with them on a group channel (/group). Their portrait is also added to your screen.


Group members and mission markers appear as purple icons on your map and minimap.
Take advantage of groups! Grouping with other players can help you complete difficult missions, gain more experience and defeat difficult enemies more quickly.
Light Side/Dark Side
Your conversation choices determine your path toward the Light Side or Dark Side.
Making certain choices in conversation reward you with either Light Side or Dark Side points.

You can check your alignment status on the Character Sheet panel.


Hover your cursor over the Alignment bar to see your Light Side and Dark Side levels as well as your total alignment value.

Some items have alignment level requirements (such as Dark II or Light IV) that you must meet before you can use them.


Special vendors also offer items with these requirements.
Leveling Your Character
Congratulations! You've gained a level!
Your health and some of your core attributes have increased, making it easier to fight more powerful enemies.
Find a class trainer when you level up. A green + symbol under the trainer's icon indicates new abilities you can learn.

Right-click on the class trainer to bring up your Abilities panel and then left-click on new abilities to train them for a fee.


Newly trained abilities are added to your Quickbar.
Vendors
Buy and sell items at a vendor.
Selling items you have no use for is a good way to earn extra credits and free up space in your inventory.

Vendors appear as credit icons on your map and minimap.


Free-to-Play Players will see increased vendor prices compared to Subscribers.

To open a vendor's shop, right-click on the vendor.


To buy an item, right-click on it in the shop inventory. To sell one of your items, right-click on it in your inventory.
Understanding Enemy Difficulty
Some enemies are more challenging than others.

Insignias attached to the portraits of enemies show their relative difficulty.


More complex insignias indicate more difficult opponents.
To get a brief description of enemies, hover your cursor over them. Targeting the enemy reveals their full details.
To defeat more challenging enemies such as Champions, Elites, and Bosses, you may need to group with other players.
Defeated
After you're defeated, you need to be revived.

Call a medical probe to be revived at your current location or return to the nearest medcenter.


The time it takes to call a medical probe increases if you're defeated more than once in a short period of time.

Free-to-Play Players are initially limited to 5 Medical Probes. Additional Medical Probes can be found in the Cartel Market.

Nearby players can also revive you if they're not in combat.


When you're defeated, your equipment's durability decreases significantly. When an item's durability is depleted, it will be unusable until it's repaired.
Returning to the nearest medcenter resets the medical probe's cooldown time and gives you a chance to repair items or purchase consumable items.
Unavailable Missions
Some missions are not immediately available.
A gray mission icon over a character's head usually indicates a mission that will become available at a higher level.
To begin the mission, return to this character when you've reached a higher level.
Daily and Weekly repeatable missions use a triangle icon with arrows. Once you've completed the mission, the icon turns gray. If you return on another day, the mission will be available again.
Managing Your Inventory
Your inventory is almost full.
If your inventory gets full, you will be unable to acquire new items. To free up space, sell items to a vendor or purchase more inventory space.

To purchase more inventory space, click on the Expand Inventory Module button in the Inventory panel.


You can purchase up to 5 additional inventory modules; the credits cost increases each time you add more space but the Cartel Coins cost remains the same.
If your inventory gets full while you're in the field, you can discard less valuable items by dragging them out of the Inventory panel and confirming that you want to destroy them.
Data Crystals
Data Crystals let you purchase specialty goods.
To see your data crystals, open your Inventory panel and then click on the Currency tab.
Mission rewards, defeated enemies, space combat and PvP Warzones are some of the many sources for data crystals.

Trade data crystals to data crystal and specialty goods vendors to get high-quality equipment.

Free-to-Play Players will find higher prices for items from these vendors compared to Subscribers.
Quick Travel
Activating Quick Travel terminals lets you shuttle between locations you've discovered.

As you explore each planet, you'll find Quick Travel terminals at special locations.


Most terminals will unlock as you reveal the map areas they reside in, otherwise to unlock a terminal, right-click on it. It is now available on your map.

When you arrive on a new planet, you unlock a terminal there automatically.


To activate Quick Travel, left-click on the ability in your Quickbar to open the Quick Travel destination map.

Left-click on your destination's icon, and a shuttle is dispatched to transport you there immediately.


Subscribers can use Quick Travel once every 6 minutes. Free-to-Play Players have a 30 minute cooldown. You can reduce Quick Travel cooldown with Legacy Unlocks from the Legacy Panel.
Social Points
Earn social points by grouping with other players.
You'll be awarded social points for participating in group conversations. The larger the group, the more social points you'll earn.
To see your social level, open the Character Sheet panel. Each level gives you access to a new tier of social items.
Social items are available from social vendors on all of the major planets.
Companions
Companion characters will join in your adventures and support you in combat.
Your companion's portrait, health bar, and abilities are located in the lower-left corner of the screen.

Right-click your companion's portrait to select their combat role: Heal, Tank, or Damage.



To set which of your companion's abilities you want them to use, right-click on an ability to toggle it on or off.

To manage your companion's equipment, select the Companion tab on the Character Sheet panel.

Companions equipment is purely cosmetic and does not affect their combat effectiveness.
Influence
Conversation choices can change the way your companion feels about you.

You will gain influence based on decisions you make in and out of conversation.


Companions generally don't view your actions in terms of Light Side or Dark Side. Instead, they value concepts such as honesty, avarice or mischief.
Read your companion's Codex entry to get a better understanding of the principles he or she values.
Higher influence improves your Companion's combat effectiveness as well as their speed and quality in performing crew skills.
Damaged and Destroyed Items
Repair your equipment regularly to keep it in good condition.
An armor icon over your character's portrait indicates that one of your equipped items is damaged or destroyed.
Items lose a small amount of durability from general wear and tear, and a larger amount of durability when you are defeated.
When an item's durability drops to 0, the item is no longer usable or provides no benefit when equipped. Replace or repair it at a vendor as soon as possible.
Mission Items
Some missions require you to use an item from your inventory to progress.

Mission items can be activated directly from the mission tracker.


You may need to select a target before you can activate the item.

You may need to use a mission item in a tight spot, such as during combat.


Drag the item to your Quickbar and use it just as if it were an ability.
You can also use mission items from the Mission Items tab of your Inventory panel.
Bonus Objectives
Some missions offer bonus objectives.

Bonus objectives appear under the corresponding mission in the mission tracker.

You must complete bonus objectives before finishing the mission they are associated with.

You don't have to complete bonus objectives, but they reward you with extra experience.


You also earn experience for any bonus objectives a group member completes.

Some bonus objectives have multiple stages that lead up to a difficult battle.


After the battle, you may have to go to a mission drop box to complete the bonus objective.
Dangerous Environments
Be careful when traveling through hazardous environments.
Environmental factors can pose risks to the unsuspecting.
Blazing infernos, toxic lakes, blistering sand dunes, freezing tundra and long falls will harm your character.
When you encounter such hazards, the safest thing to do is back up the way you came until you are out of danger.
Item Modifications
You can enhance some items by adding modifications.

Use item modifications to improve equipment at the Custom (orange) grade or above.


Item modifications fit only in compatible slots; for example, a color crystal requires a color-crystal slot.

To open the modification panel, right-click on the item while holding down the Ctrl key.


You can then right-click on appropriate modifications from your inventory or drag them into the corresponding slots.

To remove a modification, drag it from the item in the modification panel to your inventory.


After you accept the extraction cost, you can reuse the modification.

Modification extraction has a cost in Credits. Subscribers pay a reduced price compared to Free-to-Play Players.
Titles
Titles proclaim your feats and accomplishments.
Earn titles by reaching certain social or alignment levels or milestones in your class story. Some heroic missions and group mission series also grant titles.
To choose which title (if any) you want to display to other players, open the Character Sheet panel.

Click the medal icon next to your character's name and select the title you want from a list of all of the titles you've earned.

Subscribers can freely display their Titles; Free-to-Play Players can purchase the ability to display their Title with Cartel Coins.
Speaking with Companions
Companions will let you know when they want to speak with you in private.
A speech icon appears on your companion's portrait when he or she wants to talk.
Look for an opportunity to speak with your companion on your ship. Sometimes a cantina will also suffice.

When your companion is comfortable talking, the mission icon appears over his or her head.


Right-click on your companion to start the conversation.
PvP Warzone Queue
Participating in PvP Warzones earns you experience, valor points, and access to other benefits.

To queue for a Warzone, left-click on the faction icon next to your minimap. Select Queue Group if you're in a group and want to join the battle together.

Subscribers have unlimited access to Warzones. Free-to-Play Players have a weekly alottment of Warzones, but can purchase a weekly pass from the Cartel Market.

When enough players have queued, you're prompted to enter the battle.


You will be transported from your current location directly into the Warzone and returned to the same location when the battle is over.

To compete as a group against other players at your skill level, select the Ranked Warzone Arenas icon. You can examine your personal statistics by clicking the small Show PvP Stats button on the lower left side of the window. Ranked Warzone Arenas are only available to Subscribers.
Advanced Class Training
Advanced classes let you further specialize your combat style.
Choosing your advanced class gives you access to new skill sets and helps define the roles you can play in group combat.
Use the Combat Proficiencies screen to select your Advanced Class or find your advanced class trainer on a capital world or aboard your fleet's space station.
Whenever you gain a level, make sure to check the advanced class abilities available from your class trainer.
Crew Skill Trainers
Your companions can learn crew skills to earn extra credits and give you access to special items.

Visit crew skill trainers to learn about the various crew skills and choose the ones you want to train. To locate the trainers, check your map.

Subscribers can have a three crew skills simultaneously; Free-to-Play Players are limited to one crew skill but can purchase additional slots.
To manage your companions' crew skill activities, click on the gem icon on the Menu Bar or press the B key to open the Crew Management panel.
Crew skills let you assign your companions to gather resources, craft useful and valuable items and even undertake their own missions for benefits and rewards.
Combat Proficiencies
Access your Combat Proficiencies to choose specific bonuses and abilities available to your advanced class.
To open the Combat Proficiences, left-click on the person icon on the Menu Bar and then left-click on the triangle in a circle icon or press the K key.

Every time you gain a level, you increase along your discipline path.


Once you gain a utility point select one from the utility selection pane on the right side of the window. Doing so will increase your combat prowess.

If you want to change the Discipline you've selected, find a skill mentor on your fleet's space station and reset your Discipline.


Subscribers can reset their Discipline free of charge while Free-to-Play Players have to pay a cost in Credits. The cost to reset increases with each reset for Free-to-Play Players, but resets weekly.
Flashpoints
Flashpoints are action-packed special adventures designed to challenge your group.

Flashpoints involve complex or multiple missions that your group must work together to complete.

Subscribers have unlimited access to Flashpoints. Free-to-Play Players have a weekly limit on loot from Flashpoint final bosses, but can purchase a weekly pass from the Cartel Market.

Flashpoint missions usually begin on your fleet, often near the entrance to the respective flashpoint.


Entering a flashpoint creates a special "instance" for your group. To leave the instance at any time, click on the Exit Area button above your minimap.
If all players in the group leave the flashpoint before it's completed, the instance will close after an hour, and you will lose all progress.
Crafting Items
Crafting skills let you create special items by combining resources.
To open the Crafting panel, left-click on the skill in the Crew Management panel.

Browse and sort your available crafting schematics on the left and see the required components on the right.


After you've gathered the components, click on the Craft button to add it to your companion's queue.
Buy new crafting schematics from a crew skill trainer or on the Galactic Trade Network.
Gathering Resources
You can gather resources if you've trained the appropriate crew skill.
To have your companion harvest a resource node, right-click on it. To harvest it yourself, right-click on it while holding down the Shift key.
Nearby resource nodes are marked on both the world map and minimap.

You can also send your companion on gathering missions from the Crew Management panel.


These missions can be expensive, so make sure you can afford them.
Crafting Augmented Items
Augments make crafted items more powerful.

When you craft an item, there is a chance that it will have an augmentation slot.

Subscribers have a greater chance to create an augmentation slot than Free-to-Play Players.

Augment kits can be made through various crew skills or purchased from the Galactic Trade Network.


Augment Kit schematics can be acquired through Slicing missions. Augment Kits can be crafted through Armormech, Synthweaving and Armstech.

Anyone can use Augment Kits at a workbench to add or upgrade an augment slot.

Subscribers pay a reduced fee when adding an Augment Kit to an item.
Reverse Engineering
Reverse-engineer crafted items to recover resource components.
You can reverse-engineer most items you craft and some items you find in the world.

Reverse-engineering an item returns some components and could give you a schematic for a higher-quality item.


A tooltip indicates if an upgraded schematic is available to research.

Subscribers have a higher chance of schematic discovery than Free-to-Play Players.
To reverse-engineer an item in your inventory, left-click on the Reverse Engineering button and then right-click on the item.
Gifts
Gifts help earn influence with your companions.
Better gifts will earn more influence.

Different companions value different types of gifts.


Check your companions' profiles in the Codex to learn their preferences.

You can acquire gifts from crew skills missions, and some are available for purchase from vendors.


The curator on the fleet offers some of the best gifts. These gifts require you to combine gift fragments from crew skills missions.
Selling Trash Items
Your companion can help you free up space in your inventory.
If your inventory is full, your companion can sell the trash items for you.

To send your companion to sell trash items, right-click on his or her portrait and select the option from the menu.


Your companion leaves to sell all the gray-quality items in your inventory.
Selling trash items should free up some space in your inventory, and your companion will return soon with the credits from the sale.
Your Cargo Hold
Use your cargo hold to store items you don't need right away.

To find Cargo Hold Access terminals, look for the key icon on your map and minimap.

Subscribers have free access to the cargo hold. Free-to-Play players gain the Cargo Hold after aquiring Preferred Player Status with their first purchase of Cartel Coins.

When your cargo hold starts to fill up, you can buy additional cargo bays directly from the top of the Cargo Hold window.


The credits cost to purchase an additional bay increases each time, while the Cartel Coin cost is always the same.
Your cargo hold is also a good place to store crafting materials. Companions can access these components automatically while crafting.
Galaxy Map
Explore the many worlds of the Old Republic in your newly acquired starship!

Once you have acquired your personal starship you can travel to other worlds by right clicking on the galaxy map in your ship's cockpit or choosing the galaxy map option from the menu bar (shortcut Shift+M)

Use the mouse wheel to zoom in and out or left click with the cursor to zoom in to view a particular region.

Your location is shown with a green icon.

Select a destination and then click on Travel Now. Make sure you have enough credits for fuel costs!

Some destinations may also require you have the content purchased. Check the Cartel Market for new destinations to visit!
Space Combat
Engage in space combat missions to earn experience and rewards.
To pilot your starship, move your cursor around the screen. You can also use the W, A, S, and D keys to move and the spacebar to do a barrel roll.

Hover your cursor over a target and left-click to fire your ship's blasters. Hold down the left mouse button to fire continuously.

Continuous fire can clear out enemies quickly, but it prevents your shields from recharging.
To fire missiles, hold down the right mouse button and drag your cursor over up to four targets. Releasing the right mouse button fires the missiles.
Saving for a Speeder
Start saving now to purchase your Speeder.

As a Subscriber, when you reach level 10 you can learn how to pilot speeder bikes and other ground vehicles.

Free-to-Play Players can learn to pilot speeders beginning at level 20.

Before you can pilot a speeder, you have to acquire the Speeder Piloting ability from your class trainer.


Earlier access to the Speeder Piloting ability can be purchased in the Legacy Panel under Global Unlocks for Credits or Cartel Coins.

Speeders and other vehicles are expensive, so you should start saving credits now or you can click on the Cartel Market icon next to the menu bar on the top of your screen and purchase one using Cartel Coins.
Piloting Speeders
Travel across planets more quickly with your new Speeder.
To activate your Speeder ability, open your Abilities panel, click on the Vehicles tab and select your Speeder.

To summon your Speeder, click on the speeder icon. To put it away, click on the icon again.


To place your Speeder icon in your quickslots, drag the icon from your Abilities panel.
Most interior spaces prohibit Speeders and, after a brief warning period, will automatically force you to dismount.
Operations
Battle the greatest threats in the galaxy in groups of 8 or 16 players

Operations start on your fleet, but you can't enter unless you are in an ops group.


To create an ops group, create a group, right-click on your portrait and select Convert to an Ops Group.

Subscribers get free access to Operations. Free-to-Play Players can purchase weekly access using Cartel Coins.

Assistant Leads can help you manage the operation. To promote Assistant Leads in the ops group, right-click on their name and select Promote to Assistant Lead.


To rearrange players in the group, left-click on their names and drag their boxes to the desired location.
When your ops group defeats a significant challenge in an operation, you will be temporarily locked out of that content. Check the Lockouts tab of your mission log for a breakdown.
Difficulty Modes
Take on Veteran Mode missions for greater challenges and greater rewards.
For Veteran Mode flashpoints, locate the missions near the entrances to the flashpoints.
For Veteran Mode operations, right-click on your portrait and select Phase.
Operations have three difficulty modes: Story, Veteran and Master. Each mode can be played by either eight or sixteen players.
Your Saga Begins
You have taken your first steps into a massive galaxy. Epic adventure awaits!
Companions will soon begin joining you on your journeys, fighting at your side as well as providing friendship and, in some cases, romance.
You'll learn more advanced combat styles. Choose your discipline and begin honing your skills.
You'll also be able to battle other players in Warzones, a series of fiercely competitive scenarios where your team fights for glory.
Explore the Galaxy
You will soon undertake an epic journey and visit many worlds in your personal starship.
You'll have the chance to take the helm of your own ship and embrace the freedom to travel wherever you choose.
Engaging in daring space missions! Blast your enemies with laser fire and missiles, and earn powerful upgrades for your ship.
Join friends for flashpoints that put you into volatile and deadly situations. The choices are difficult, and the battles require smart tactics and teamwork.
Fulfill Your Destiny
You've proven yourself a hero, but the greatest experiences and challenges are still ahead.
Upon reaching level 10, you'll create your own Star Wars Legacy and bind your characters together as family and friends to unlock new skills and opportunities.
At level 50 and beyond, confront the most powerful threats in the galaxy in large-scale multi-group operations.
Long-hidden mysteries, untold dangers and new challenges lie waiting for you in every corner of the galaxy!
Fleet Pass
Quickly travel back to your fleet with the Fleet Pass item or ability.

Subscribers gain the Emergency Fleet Pass ability. It lets you transport back to your fleet.

Free-to-Play Players do not have access to the Emergency Fleet Pass ability, but can purchase single-use items from the Cartel Market.

To activate the Fleet Pass, open the Abilities panel and left-click on Emergency Fleet Pass on the General tab.
Free-to-Play Players will not have this ability listed.
Purchase single-use Fleet Pass items from the security key vendor on your fleet or from the Cartel Market.
Legacy
Bind your characters together to unlock new perks and abilities.

To create your Legacy, enter a Legacy surname and click Create.

To show off your legacy name, become a subscriber today! Legacy surname display can also be unlocked with Cartel Coins.

To build out your family tree, drag a character from the character pool onto the larger tree menu.


To bring up the relationship menu, drag the character onto another character in the family tree. This radial menu lets you select the relationship the two characters have with each other.
The Global Unlocks tab contains different features that may be unlocked via a combination of Legacy level, credits, Cartel Coins or other accomplishments.
Activity Finder
The Activity Finder can help you join up with other players for multiplayer experiences or find a solo mission thats just right.
To open the Activity Finder panel, click on the group icon next to your minimap.

Select a combat role from the top of the panel.

You may notice a Role In Need for a particular activity. Playing as the listed role will provide you with additional rewards.

From the left portion of the panel, choose the mission type you want to queue for.

To finalize your selection and enter the queue, click on Join Queue.

Remember, queuing randomly within a category will provide a daily reward bonus.
<u>Click here to continue...</u>
Show/Hide Tutorial Notifications
Cartel Market
Sample from the Hutt Cartel's expansive collection of goods.
The Cartel Market offers many unique and interesting items to the galaxy's adventurers. Items in the Cartel Market can be acquired for a modest amount of Cartel Coins.

Access the Cartel Market from the main screen. To visit the Market, simply click on the Cartel Coin icon on your screen.



Items in the Cartel Market can't be found anywhere else and require Cartel Coins to purchase. Subscribers receive a monthly allotment of Cartel Coins.
Additional Cartel Coins can be purchased from the Add Coins button.
Shopping with the Cartel
Purchasing from the Market
Claiming your purchase
Browse the Cartel's exclusive selection to find the best deals this side of Hutt Space!
Collect your purchases into your inventory to use or gift to friends.

Select one of the helpful categories to see what the Cartel Market offers.The FEATURED category will often update to show the galaxy's best deals!

Items in a category load to the right and display with their price, a helpful image as well as Sale and New Item indicators.

Select any item in the Market to see the Item Details. The Item Details displays a description, bullet point details and any restrictions to the item.



Click Show Items to display the in-game item. From here, you can preview armor, weapons and even mounts directly on your character!

Click on BUY NOW and your purchase is transferred to Unclaimed Items.

Your Cartel Coins will be adjusted immediately to reflect your new balance. You can continue shopping and add more items to Unclaimed Items.

Purchases at the Cartel Market are placed into your Unclaimed Items. Unclaimed Items is a convenient space to collect all of your purchase while at the Market.



Unclaimed Items is accessed from the Cartel Market and holds purchases for as long as you need.

Purchases in your Unclaimed Items can be transferred into your inventory or returned for a full refund.

There are buttons to claim and return items individually. There is also an option to claim all items at once.

Some items will have warning icons to indicate restrictions for an item. Take the time to read any restrictions on an item you have purchased in case you need to return it!



Most items in the Market (including unlocks!) can be sent to other players as gifts.
Achievements
Achievements are badges that recognize major accomplishments.
To view your achievements, open your Legacy panel. Achievement categories are listed on the left side of the panel. Click a category to view specific achievements.

Achievements can be awarded for defeating enemies, completing missions, and many other activities.



Click on an achievement icon to see what is required to unlock it, as well as what rewards it grants.

Every achievement awards Prestige Points. Your total Prestige Score is the sum of all unlocked achievements.



Some achievements may award items, titles or Cartel coins in addition to Prestige points.
Rise of the Hutt Cartel
Macrobinoculars are used to identify and scan distant targets of interest. Right click the macrobinoculars item in your mission items inventory to activate it.

Objects that can be scanned by the macrobinoculars will highlight orange when you mouse over them.

Left click on highlighted objects to zoom in and positively identify them.
Only certain targets can be identified with the macrobinoculars. Identifying targets may advance missions, unlock achievements, or trigger other events for you.

The Seeker Droid can be used in specially designated areas to find hidden items. Right click the Seeker Droid in your mission items inventory to activate it. After activating the Seeker Droid, use the targeting reticule to select an area to search in.

If the Seeker Droid finds something in the search area, the searched area will highlight green, and the droid will bring the item to you and put it directly in your inventory. If the droid does not find anything, the area will highlight red.

If the droid finds nothing, or does not find the item you are looking for, try searching in different locations. You will not find what you seek by searching the same spot many times. Be warned; you may find things other than items as you search new areas!

Perform discreet reconnaissance with EV2 Macrobinoculars
