Introducing Collections
Introducing Collections: Basic Navigation

Collections provide a convenient means for tracking many items you have obtained including those from the Cartel Market, Market Packs, Collector's Edition, and more. Items are logged in your Collections upon binding, allowing you to track which items you have collected, which ones you have not yet acquired, and to retrieve duplicate copies later.
Your Collections can be accessed from the Inventory window via the button in the lower left, or from the Cartel Market window via the button in the upper right.

The left pane of the Collections window is an index of Categories which can be expanded into subcategories. Items are organized under these categories by the source of the item.

Items can be browsed by clicking through the category tree or by clicking on the elements in the right pane.

Within a given category, there may be multiple pages of items. If so, buttons will be displayed along the bottom of the pane, allowing you to quickly move between pages.
Items are unlocked in your Collections by binding them to your character. Once the item is unlocked in your Collections, its icon will appear at full brightness. Note that all items in an Armor Set must be bound to become unlocked.
Credit Escrow
Transferring Credits from your Escrow.

Free-to-Play and Preferred players have a lower cap on their Credits than Subscribers. Credits earned beyond this cap are stored in Escrow. Your stored Credit Escrow can be viewed from the Currency tab of your Inventory.
You may transfer credits from your Escrow to your available balance via the Access Escrow button.

Accessing your Escrow allows you to transfer Credits to your available balance at the cost of Cartel Coins. There are multiple options for Credit amounts to transfer. Transferred Credits can exceed the Credits cap.

The 50,000 Credit transfer may always be done regardless of your stored Escrow, and will transfer all available credits in escrow if you have fewer than the full 50,000. The larger Credit transfers may only be performed if you have at least that many Credits in Escrow.

In addition to transfering Credits via the Escrow panel, you may purchase single-use Escrow Transfer items from the Cartel Market. These items are available in various Credit amounts.
Use of these items transfers the specified Credits amount from your Escrow to your current balance. You must have at least the specified Credits available in your Escrow to use these items.
Dye Modules
Change the color of gear to suit your tastes.

Most pieces of gear have an enhancement slot for Dye Modules. Dye Modules allow you to alter the color scheme of such gear, and are available from Artifice and Packs in the Cartel Market, as well as some exclusive vendors.
Each piece of gear has areas that will take a primary hue, and most (but not all) have areas that will take a secondary hue. Dye Modules are available as dual-color modules, providing both a primary and secondary hue, as well as single-color modules, providing either a primary hue or a secondary hue, but not both. In all cases, only one Dye Module can be applied to a given piece of gear.

You may choose to dye each piece of your gear individually, or you can use the Unify Colors option to allow your other gear to match a dye applied to the equipment in your chest slot.

Dye modules can be previewed without adding them to gear by pressing CTRL+Left Click on the dye module itself. This will open a preview window displaying the effects of applying this dye module to all currently-worn gear.

You can add a Dye Module to gear using the same methods as adding any other enhancement. Press CTRL+Right Click to access the field modification menu, or select the item when using an Item Modification table.
Adding a Dye Module to gear that already has a Dye Module applied will replace the existing Dye Module with the new one, and destroy the original.
Dye Modules can be removed. Doing so will restore the equipment to its original colorscheme, but will destroy the Dye Module in the process.
Appearance Designer
Creating a whole new you!

The Appearance Designer offers the ability to change a character's facial features, body type and species.

Appearance Designer Kiosks are located on the Republic and Imperial Fleets as well as on Coruscant and Dromund Kaas.

Basic customization options are shared with Character Creation and always available. Some options are unlocked with Cartel Coins and will be displayed in purple. Options that are available because of Legacy are gold.

If a selection is made that not currently unlocked an icon will appear showing how many Cartel Coins are required to unlock it. A locked option can be purchased from the Cartel Market or directly in Appearance Designer. Purchased customization options are unlocked for your account.

When a Legacy Species is unlocked, that species and its Appearance options will become available in Appearance Designer. Species may be unlocked directly in Appearance Designer.

After making your desired selections, use the "Change Appearance" button to change your character and complete the transaction. Note that slider changes are free of charge when changing your Species.
Tracking Collections
Tracking Collections, Inspecting Items
Each Collection category or subcategory tracks the items you have unlocked. Your completion progress for sets of items is shown in both the category pane and in the right items pane.

If an item in your Collections is currently available on the Cartel Market, the "Open Cartel Market" button in the lower left of its icon to take you directly to that item on the Cartel Market.

You may see additional information on the items in your Collection by clicking on them. From here, items can be previewed and information about any restrictions and stats are visible.

While Inspecting an item, Collections items that represent a set of items will have a "Show Items" button. Pressing this button will display the individual items in the set, allowing you to preview their appearance and statistics. You may also simply CTRL+Left Click the item to preview it.
While in this mode, the "Show Items" button will become a "Show Details" button, allowing you to return to the previous view.
Retrieving From Collections
Unlocking and Retrieving Items from Your Collection

To unlock an item in your Collections, it must be Bound to you. Merely possessing the item will not unlock it. Note that all items in an Armor Set must be bound to unlock it.
Once unlocked, a duplicate copy of that Collection item can be retrieved at any time from your Collections. Retrieved items will be Bound to the character, and cannot be traded.

To retrieve a copy of an unlocked item from your Collections, press the Transfer button. This will transfer a Bound copy of the item (or all items in the set, if appropriate) to your character's inventory. You must have enough space in your inventory to accommodate the transfer.

Unlocking an item in your Collections makes that item available for retrieval for the character that originally bound the item. This character is able to retrieve the item for free at any time.
Other characters on your account may also purchase the ability to retrieve the item for a small one-time purchase with Cartel Coins.
Galactic Starfighter
Hangar - Overview
Learn the major features of the Galactic Starfighter hangar.

Overview
The Galactic Starfighter hangar is broken up into several easy to navigate elements:

Account Info and Requisition: (The currency of Galactic Starfighter) info can be found along the top of the hangar.

Tabs: Just below this you will find tabs that provide access to every section of the hangar.

Panes: Each tab is separated into panes that will allow you to make selections, observe changes, and access details about your ships and their various components.

Tabs
Starting with Ships and moving all the way through Launch, the tabs along the top of the hangar will step you through the process of readying a ship.



Each tab represents another aspect of your ship's loadout. Click on the tabs individually to access their content.

Panes
The contents of each tab in the hangar are broken into three separate panes of information.

The left pane will allow you to select various options.

The center pane will display the choices you've made and how they affect your ship.

The right pane contains details about your ship, selected component, cosmetics, or crew member. This is also where you can manage component upgrades and paint jobs.
Hangar - Launch Tab
Learn how to ready your ships and launch into battle.

Overview
From the Launch Tab you can review and ready ships to queue for battle or toggle back to other tabs to adjust your equipment loadouts.



At the bottom of the tab you'll find your readied ships bar, indicating which ships you've chosen to take into battle.

Getting into the action is as simple as choosing which ships you want to ready and pressing one of the Queue buttons.

Readied Ships
To ready a ship, simply click on an empty slot and select a ship from the selection menu that appears. To swap an already filled slot with a different ship, click on the slot and press the Select Your Ship button to bring up the selection menu.

You can rearrange readied ships by dragging icons from one position on the bar to another. Drag an icon off of the bar completely to remove it from the bar.

Details about a selected loadout will show up in the right pane.

Queuing
The queue buttons appear at the bottom of the right pane on the Launch Tab and allow you to either queue for Battle or Group Battle. Both queue options will put you in line for the next battle once enough other players are queued as well.

If you are currently part of a group, use the Group Battle button to queue your entire group for battle so that when you enter combat, you'll all be on the same team.

Flying into battle as part of a group is a great way to facilitate more focused communication during combat.
Hangar - Ships Tab
Learn about creating loadouts and choosing ships.

Ship Roles
Ships in Galactic Starfighter are organized by roles. Roles are overarching categories that define a ship's basic functionality.

Within each role there may be many different ships, each with its own unique spin on the role.

By default, all pilots begin with one Scout role ship and one Strike Fighter role ship unlocked. By spending fleet requisition gained by completing battles, you can purchase new ships for these and future roles from the left pane of the Ships Tab.

Choosing a Ship
Clicking on a ship role will reveal a selection of ships you currently own for that role.

Mouse over a ship in the list to see its stats. Choosing components and crew in the other tabs will modify these stats.

Clicking on a ship from the list will allow you to see it in the center pane and display its technical details in the right pane.

Details
Detailed technical information about your selected ship can be seen in the right pane. From here you can make decisions about which ship you want to fly based on stats such as:

Blaster, Shield, and Engine power pools & regen rates.

Hull health & damage reduction

Engine speed, turn rate, evasion, and boosting.

Sensor and Communications range & dampening.
Hangar - Components Tab
Learn how to equip and upgrade your ship's components.

Overview
Components are your ship's weapons, engines, systems, and defenses. Every ship comes equipped with a default set of components allowing you to get into action quickly. As you become a more skilled pilot you can purchase your own complement of components to suit your piloting style.

Major components are self-contained ship systems such as blasters and engines

Minor components are sytems that can passively alter the effectiveness of multiple other systems.

Components
Components are broken into categories in the left pane. Clicking on a category will show you all the components you currently own and can equip as well as those you can purchase.

Clicking on a component will show you any physical changes it will make to your ship in the center pane while also bringing up details and upgrade info in the right pane.

Clicking on an owned component in the list immediately equips it to your ship and adds it to the current loadout. Unowned, but purchasable components will be grayed out and have a purchase button alongside them.

Upgrades
Every component has a set of upgrades that can be purchased using Requisition, a type of currency gained by participating in Galactic Starfighter battles.



Upgrades enhance various aspects of a component's functionality such as making blasters stronger and engines faster.
Hangar - Cosmetics Tab
Learn about cosmetic modifications for your ships.

Cosmetics
Cosmetics are visual modifications to your ship such as paint jobs, blaster colors, and engine trails. Such customizations have no effect on your ship's performance in battle, but allow you to further personalize your starfighter.
Every ship has access to a number of cosmetic options that can be purchased to customize its appearance.

Cosmetic modifications are listed within the left pane.

Purchase and Preview
Clicking on an owned modification in the left pane will automatically apply it to the current ship (paint jobs) or component (blasters and engine trails).

Purchasable cosmetic modifications will be grayed out and can be boughtd by pressing the currency icon next to their name.



Both locked and unlocked cosmetics will preview on your ship in the center pane when selected.

Customization



Some cosmetics (like paint jobs) will have additional customization options. These options will appear in the right pane of the hangar when a cosmetic has been selected and allow you to further customize the look and feel by purchasing additional options or by selecting one of the defaults.
Hangar - Crew Tab
Learn about choosing and assigning crew members.

Crew Members
Crew members are characters that can be assigned to various positions on your ship and that confer bonuses and additional combat abilities. There are two types of crew member:

Support Crew: Provides your ship with passive bonuses related to their position.

Copilot: Provides an additional active ability that can be used in combat.

When a crew member is selected, detailed information about that crew member and their bonuses will be shown in the right pane.

Crew members can be purchased from within the hangar by pressing the currency icon next to their name, but you can also unlock your class' companions as crew members as you encounter them on the ground.

Support Crew


There are four support crew positions. Each crew member has a specific position they are allowed to fill.

In the left pane on the Crew tab is a list of each position. Clicking on a position will open a list of crew members that can be assigned to that position. Clicking on an unlocked crew member will assign them to that position. Locked crew members will be grayed out and have a purchase button alongside them.

As with components, each ship may have a different complement of crew.

Copilots
Your copilot is chosen from among your currently assigned support crew.

Clicking on the copilot position will open a list with only those currently assigned support crew members in it. Clicking on a crew member from this list will assign them as your copilot.

In addition to the passive abilities they apply as a member of your support crew, your copilots all have active abilities that you can use during battle. These abilities will appear along with your systems, shields, and engine abilities on screen during combat.

Your copilot is also the voice of your ship and will bark comments during battle.
Welcome to Galactic Starfighter! Click on the Galactic Starfighter icon on the left-side of the minimap or press "H" to access your Hangar and launch into battle!
Combat HUD
Learn about the Heads Up Display for Galactic Starfighter combat.

Combat: Most information you need will be displayed in the center of the screen.


Targeting Reticle: Your cursor position, where your ship is pointed and where your weapons will fire.

Firing Arc: A circle representing the area within which a weapon may fire.

Enemy and Objective Indicators: Icons indicating the direction of enemies and objectives not currently on the screen.


These appear around your firing arcs.

Other: Two on-screen elements that will be very useful during combat are the Scorecard and Map.



The scorecard shows the current progress of the battle with team scores, objective status indicators, and time remaining.



The map is a top down view of the battle area as a whole. On the map you will be able to see the positions and movement of your allies, enemies, and objectives within sensor range.

Power: Your ship has three power pools that you can manage during combat: Blaster Power, Shield Power, and Engine Power.



Blasters, Shields, and Engines each have their own on-screen indicators showing how much power is left in their pools. Regen of these pools can be managed using the F1-F4 keys.
Flight Controls
Learn about the Flight Controls for Galactic Starfighter

Direction and Movement: Direction is controlled by moving your mouse. Moving your mouse forwards and backwards will pitch your ship up and down. Moving your mouse left and right will yaw your ship from side to side.



Spatial movement is handled using the W, A, S, and D keys on the keyboard. W and S control your forward movement, by increasing and decreasing the throttle respectively. A and D will roll your ship left and right.

Throttle: All ships have a default speed that they will move at regardless of whether the pilot adjusts the throttle or not.

Pressing W will increase the ship's throttle to full. Pressing S will slow the ship below the default speed, but not stop it completely. Pressing X will stop the ship completely until the throttle is again engaged.

Visual representation of your ship's current speed is shown on the throttle gauge on the right side of your screen.

By holding SPACE to engage boosters, a ship can move faster than its top speed for as long as it has engine power to spend.

Engine Power: Using boosters and certain special abilities will expend engine power. Engine power is measured by a bar along the right hand side of your screen.



Engine power will regenerate slowly while not being actively drained.
Combat Controls
Learn about the Combat Controls for Galactic Starfighter.

Targeting: In order to effectively destroy an enemy, you first need to target them.

TAB: Targets the enemy closest to you.

R: Targets the enemy who most recently damaged you.

E: Targets the enemy currently under your reticule.

When you have an enemy targeted you'll see two reticules for them. The first will always be centered on their ship, turning red when they're in range. The second is the lead indicator, which shows you where you will need to fire in order to hit your target.

Attacking: Each ship has primary and secondary weapons, fired by the left and right mouse buttons respectively.

Primary Weapons: Most primary weapons are blasters that only require you to aim at the enemy's lead indicator and fire to attack.

Secondary Weapons: Most secondary weapons require you to lock-on before firing. To lock-on, hold down your right mouse button while a target is in range and within your firing arc. Let go of the button once the target is locked to fire.

Railguns: Railguns are a type of secondary weapon only available to gunships. Pressing the right mouse button enters sniping mode and the left button charges up your railgun to fire. The more charge, the more damage done.

Using Abilities: Your choice of Systems, Shields, Engines, and Copilot will all give you additional abilities that can be used in combat.

In combat, abilities will show up in component-specific slots on your screen and can be fired using the number keys.



Some abilities may require you to have a target in order to be used.

Icons for negative and positive effects from abilities that are currently applied to you will appear over your shield indicator.
Battle Type - Domination
Learn about the Domination battle type for Galactic Starfighter.

DEFEAT ALL ENEMIES

If the lights on a satellite are red then it is controlled by the enemy team.

Taking control of satellites is the best way to score during the domination game mode and defeating nearby enemies is the first step in this process.

Enemies include not just players on the opposing team, but also the defense turrets that appear near captured objectives.

STAY CLOSE / KEEP ENEMIES AWAY



If the lights on a satellite are white it is neutral and whichever team approaches it first can try to capture it.

As long as there are no enemies within the capture radius of a satellite it can be taken over for your team. If an enemy comes near however, the capture process will halt.

As you capture the satellite you will see its lights change color. When all the lights are green, the satellite has been captured for your team.

DEFEND YOUR SATELLITE



When your team controls a satellite, the lights are green.

Captured satellites generate points for your team. Over time defense turrets will also appear, up to three in total. If there are enemies within the satellite's capture radius however, no new turrets will appear.

In addition to generating points for your team, owning a satellite will also create a new respawn location nearby to help you defend it.
Welcome to Galactic Starfighter
Take your battle to space! Get ready for PvP Dogfighting adventures as you fight for your faction.

BATTLE!

The struggle between the Empire and the Republic has escalated and extended the conflict to space.

The call for pilots resounds across the galaxy.

Choose your side and take your battle to space!

DOMINATE!

Jump in and choose your side as you join intense 12v12 battles with your allies in new battle zones set in space.

Choose one of three unique gameplay roles as you take on PvP challenges.

Test your skills in battle with the Scout, Strike Fighter, or Gunship!

CUSTOMIZE!

Discover over 14 ships and customize your ship with paint jobs, components, blaster/engine colors and more!

Bring your Companions from the ground game with you into space and leverage their unique abilities to your advantage.

Earn new Companions as you progress to build your crew!

Welcome to the Galactic Starfighter Hangar. Tutorials for each Hangar section will be made available as you navigate through them. You can find all your tutorials by opening the SW:TOR Game Menu or enabling tutorial alerts in your Preferences.
For a brief solo lesson in flying your starfighter, press the tutorial button in the top-right corner of the Hangar.
Battle Type - Team Deathmatch
Learn about the Team Deathmatch battle type for Galactic Starfighter.

RACK UP THE MOST KILLS

Team Deathmatch pits two teams of players against each other in deadly PvP combat to determine which side can rack up the most kills.

Each battle area will have a number of power-ups scattered throughout the map. Flying through these powerups will give your ship a powerful bonus to engines, blasters, shields, or overall damage!

GRAB THE POWER-UPS

Engine Overcharge (purple): Refills engine power. Increases your engine power regen, movement speed, and evasion.

Weapon Overcharge (yellow): Refills blaster power and ammo. Increases your blaster power regen.

Shield Overcharge (blue): Refills shield power. Increases your shield power regen and allows regen in combat.

Damage Overcharge (red): Significantly increases your damage with primary and secondary weapons.

DEFEAT THE ENEMY

Your goal in a Team Deathmatch battle is to ensure that your team reaches the score limit before the other team or before time runs out. Points in Team Deathmatch battles are gained in one way only:

Defeating enemy Starfighters!
Galactic Strongholds
Galactic Strongholds: Getting Started
Start building your home in Star Wars: The Old Republic by purchasing a stronghold today!

You can purchase a stronghold at the appropriate Stronghold Directory. Directories may be found on the Fleet, as well as on the various worlds where strongholds are located, including Nar Shaddaa and Tatooine.

Strongholds are shared across your Legacy, and you can have a maximum of four. Some strongholds, such as the Kaas City and Coruscant Apartments, have a faction alignment. You may travel to these strongholds with any character in your Legacy, but characters aligned with the enemy faction will need to pay a smuggler's fee.

Once you've purchased a Stronghold, you can travel to it by opening the Stronghold Management Window from your Menu Bar and clicking the Travel button.

You can exit your Stronghold by clicking the Exit Area button above your minimap. You will have the option to return to the coordinates you traveled from, as well as an option to exit to the planet your stronghold is located on. If you are a subscriber, you will also have the option to return to the Fleet or to your personal starship.

Your initial purchase of a stronghold will grant you access to the entry area and a handful of rooms. You may expand your stronghold further by clicking on locked doors and making additional purchases with credits or Cartel Coins.

Each expansion you purchase will grant you access to the associated room, increase the maximum number of decorations you can place, and increase your maximum player occupancy.
Galactic Strongholds: Customizing and Decorating
Editing layouts and placing decorations. Start expanding and customizing your stronghold right away!

To start placing decorations, click the button on your toolbar to enter EDIT MODE. While you are in Edit Mode, you can right-click a hook layout to pop up the hook editor.

The hook editor window will display a complete list of decorations that will fit into the hook you've selected. You can filter this list by category and subcategory. Decorations will often fit into multiple hook types. Eligible hooks are displayed in the decoration's tooltip.

Once you've selected the decoration you want, click the PLACE button to insert it into the hook. You can then nudge and rotate the decoration within the hook using the sliders that appear.

If you aren't happy with your decorating options for a certain hook, you can usually modify it by clicking the LAYOUTS button and selecting a different set of hooks. You can preview different layouts by selecting them. Clicking APPLY LAYOUT will confirm the change and automatically pick up any decorations placed in the associated hooks.

You will earn prestige for your Legacy with each new decoration you unlock in your personal collection. As you place decorations, your stronghold completion percentage will increase. Your stronghold's prestige value is determined by its completion percentage multiplied by your Legacy's prestige. Prestige is used to rank strongholds on the Public Listings.

You can also unlock stronghold labels, which allow you to set a different name for your stronghold in the Stronghold Management Window. You can also select a different character in your Legacy to be the official owner.
Collecting Decorations & Crafting Prefabs
Learn where to collect decorations and how to craft them with Fabricator Droids!

There are many ways to collect new decorations for your stronghold. Some can be purchased from vendors for credits or data crystals. Many decorations drop as loot in Flashpoints and Operations, and special wall decorations called trophies can be unlocked by completing certain achievements.

Decorations can also be obtained on the Cartel Market. You can browse all available decorations by clicking on the PERSONAL button in your Stronghold Management window.

You can build decorations for your stronghold by crafting prefabs, which can be exchanged for decorations at a Fabricator Droid on the Fleet.

Armstechs, Armormechs, and Cybertechs can craft Industrial Prefabs, whereas Artificers, Biochems, and Synthweavers can craft Synthetic Prefabs.

All crafting professions can train the first tier of schematics for these prefabs starting at a skill level of 150.

Each prefab type is divided into three tiers: MK-1, MK-2, and MK-3. You can learn the schematics from your crew skill trainer, but higher tier prefab schematics require a higher skill level.

Some of the most impressive and useful decorations can be obtained with Universal Prefabs.

Crafting a Universal Prefab requires combining a Synthetic Prefab with an Industrial Prefab, along with a Fabricator Design and a Fabricator Crystal. This may require the cooperation of multiple crafters.
Planetary Conquests
Learn how you can support the war effort and earn rewards - or join a guild and conquer planets!

As the war effort evolves, Conquest Events provide you with a new set of shifting objectives every week. The current conquest event can be viewed by opening your Mission Log and clicking on the CONQUEST tab.

Complete objectives to earn conquest points and meet your personal point target before the end of the event to rewards. Your conquests points are reset each week so pay close attention to the countdown timer!

You don't need to be in a guild to participate in conquest events, but it's a good idea to join one.

During each conquest event, several planets will be contested. If your guild owns a flagship, you may choose to invade a planet, which provides additional benefits and pits your guild against others on that planet's leaderboard for the duration of the event.

Whichever guild places first on the leaderboard takes control of the planet when the next event begins!

If your guild completes its conquest point target, every guild member who met his or her personal contribution will be granted special guild rewards. Each guild member's contribution can be viewed in the guild window. If you join or leave a guild, your contribution will be reset.

Conquering planets unlocks special privileges, including temporary access to the special Command Walker mount, increased potency of flagship orbital support, achievements, and more!
Perks of Stronghold Ownership
Unlock Legacy Stronghold Storage, gathering decorations, and more!

Legacy Stronghold Storage is a new way to store your items and share them between characters in your Legacy. You can obtain access to this new feature by unlocking the Legacy Stronghold Storage utility decoration. Once you've unlocked the decoration, simply place it in your stronghold.

Your Stronghold Storage will start with one bay containing 80 item slots. You can purchase additional storage bays for your Legacy with credits or Cartel Coins. Crew Skills will automatically use materials from your Stronghold Storage if your personal inventory and Cargo Hold are exhausted.

Gathering node decorations can be earned by completing Conquest Events. These decorations can be harvested for crafting materials simply by interacting with them in your stronghold!

Harvesting from one of these decorations has a chance to cause resource exhaustion, which prevents your character from gathering inside strongholds for a while. Any player with a silver key to your stronghold will be able to use these decorations.

Completing your stronghold establishes a power base for your Legacy that improves your influence throughout the galaxy and increases your Conquest point gain. As the completion percentages for your strongholds increase, your Conquest stronghold bonus also increases, which helps you earn rewards faster and makes you a better contributor to your guild's conquest score.

With all four strongholds fully completed, you'll earn +100% Conquest points!
Welcome to Galactic Strongholds! Visit a Stronghold Directory on the Fleet to get started customizing your very own bastion of military might and personal luxury.
Welcome to Game Update 3.0: Shadow of Revan! Click here for more information.
Shadow of Revan
Learn about the all-new story and features in the Shadow of Revan Digital Expansion!

New Epic Storyline!
Experience the epic new storyline at level 55! Travel to your ship and pick up the mission "Shadow of Revan: Prelude" to begin. Your mission starts with the explosive Forged Alliances story arc. You'll pick up where you left off in the story, with a new option to play through these Flashpoints in SOLO MODE with the help of a combat support droid. Completing this prelude will prepare you for the challenge ahead by providing a powerful set of level 55 gear.

Explore New Planets!
Adventure beckons on the remote world of Rishi, a tropical paradise that's become a lawless hideaway for pirates, smugglers, and anyone else who wishes to remain hidden from the eyes of the greater galaxy. Then continue the story on Yavin 4, a primeval moon steeped in ancient mysteries of the Force-and overrun by vicious beasts and ruthless Massassi warriors.

Level up to 60!
The new Discipline system gives you a clear role in combat. Choose your path, and customize your play style by selecting from a variety of utility powers! Level up to 60 to unlock new powers and unleash your full potential in new OPERATIONS and FLASHPOINTS! Or queue for Warzones to rejoin the frontlines and earn powerful new PvP gear.
Welcome to Game Update 3.0: Shadow of Revan!
Welcome to Outfit Designer! Open your Character Sheet or press the C key to get started!
Welcome to Outfit Designer! Click here for more information.
Outfit Designer
Access your Outfit Designer to create custom appearances for your character!

To access the Outfit Designer, select the Character Sheet icon from your Menu Bar or press C. The window opens on your currently equipped gear. Click any of the numbered tabs on the right to change the view to the Outfit Designer.

Select the Inventory icon from your Menu Bar or press I to access your inventory. Right-click or drag and drop an item from your inventory to "stamp" that item to the appropriate slot for your selected outfit. Stamping an item assigns the appearance of that item to the slot. It does not consume the item, and you can stamp the same item into multiple outfits. Note that stamping and committing an item to your outfit will bind that item to your character.

Once you are satisfied with your new look, select the Commit Changes button at the bottom of the window to save it. You will be presented with a confirmation window informing you of the total outfit build cost in credits, as well as any items that will become bound. Select OK to save your outfit, withdraw the necessary funds, bind any unbound items, and activate the outfit for your character. To unlock additional outfit slots, simply select the plus (+) tab and choose whether you want to purchase the slot with credits or Cartel Coins. Switching between numbered tabs allows you to preview your outfits. Select the Apply button over any previewed outfit to show off your new look!
Knights of the Fallen Empire
Knights of the Fallen Empire is divided into exciting player-focused chapters.
New Max Level Player Tutorial
Chapter I includes the new player tutorial experience.
The chapterPlay Button will allow you to quickly jump into the active chapter at any time.

Each chapter has a series of checkpoints that save your progress and returning location.

Clicking the Play Button will bring you right back to the current checkpoint and allow you to continue the chapter.
Your friends can join you on your adventure. Form a group and right-click on your portrait icon to invite your group mates into your story.
As a new player, you are starting with a subset of your offensive abilities.
As you progress through chapter I you will unlock more of your class discipline's abilities.
Once you have finished with the tutorial and Chapter I, you will have access to all of your class's abilities.

The new-player tutorial has been enabled. You will gain new abilities at key moments as you play through the first chapter. The tutorial can be disabled and re-enabled at any time in the preferences menu.
A new-player tutorial is available, would you like to enable it? You can disable it again at any time by hitting ESC and left-clicking on the "Disable Tutorial" button on the menu.
Welcome to Knights of the Fallen Empire! Click here for more information.
Learn about the all-new story and features in the Knights of the Fallen Empire!
Alliance
Learn how to gain Influence and rewards by building a galactic Alliance!

CONTINUE THE EPIC STORY The battle against the Eternal Empire continues on the planet Odessen! Forge your Alliance and continue your personal Star Wars: The Old Republic saga through Classic Conversations, presenting you more dialog options and personal interactions as you rally your Alliance camp leaders.

STRENGTHEN YOUR ALLIANCE By increasing your Influence Rank with each of the Alliance camp leaders you will strengthen your Alliance, giving you new story choices and avenues of adventure! Increase your influence by completing Alliance Alert Missions for specialist contacts or turning in Supply Crates obtainable from Planetary Heroic Missions, the Star Fortress flashpoint, and more!

REAP THE REWARDS For each Supply Crate you turn in your contact will give you back a cut as a reward. As your Influence grows watch each Alliance camp evolve into bustling centers of activity bent toward defeating the Eternal Empire.
Companions & Contacts
Learn how to summon Followers, travel to Contacts, and manage Alerts.

FOLLOWERS Followers are Companions and Alliance members that you can summon to fight by your side in battle using the Summon This Crew Member button. Followers' Combat Roles can be changed via the drop down next to their name on the right side of the window. Increasing your Influence with Followers will make them more proficient at combat and Crew Skills.

CONTACTS Contacts become available during the Knights of the Fallen Empire storyline and are Alliance members, potential Followers, and other important persons. You can increase your Influence with Contacts by performing Alliance Alert Missions or turning in Supply Crates. You can Quick Travel to a Contact using the Travel Button next to their name on the right side of the window.

ALERTS Beginning with the Knights of the Fallen Empire storyline you will occasionaly receive Alerts from your Contacts and Followers. This indicates that they have a mission for you to undertake. Selecting an Alert from the list will allow you to view the contact (if they are known to you) and Travel to Alert Location.

New Epic Storyline!
Experience the epic new storyline at level 60! Travel to your ship and pick up the mission "Chapter I: The Hunt" to begin. Your mission starts with the explosive first chapter in the Knights of the Fallen Empire story arc. You'll pick up where the story left off after Ziost, delivered in all new episodic story Chapters. Each chapter can be completed solo or with a group of friends. There are a total of 9 chapters at launch and more chapters will be released in the following months.

Explore New Planets!
The planet Zakuul has become the new seat of power in the galaxy. Its skyscrapers reach toward the stars while its lowest levels brim with danger and crime, all surrounded by a vast and savage swamp. Those who wish to evade Zakuul's power hide out on Asylum, a smuggling den floating among the clouds where freedom and anarchy reign. The shadowy forest world of Odessen holds many mysteries; its remote location is a secret known only to a select few....

Level Up To 65!
New abilities and powers await you as you progress to level 65. All Operations have been raised to level 65 and have all new gear and rewards waiting for you. All your favorite Flashpoints have had solo modes added with all new rewards. Redesigned Core Game Experience The core leveling experience from 1 - 60 has been redesigned with a streamlined quest progression that keeps you fully focused on your character's personal story.
The Eternal Championship
Fight for fame, fortune, and glory in Zakuul's Arena Grand!

Enter the Arena Grand
Enter the Eternal Championship by using the Arena Terminal in the Platform 6 Cantina on Zakuul. From there you can acquire the [Daily] mission to enter the Mayhem event.
You can also acquire the [Weekly] missions to defeat the bosses of specific rounds from this terminal.
When you're ready to enter the event head down the nearby elevator and enter the Arena Grand flashpoint instance gate.

Compete for the Eternal Championship
Each round of Mayhem at the Arena Grand begins with an introduction by Rokka Rey, after which your battle with that round's boss will begin.
Between rounds you will go into an intermission period. Use the Intermission Terminal to choose whether you want to continue or leave the competition.
If you are defeated in any round, you will be sent back to intermission, but incur no other penalties.

Reap the Rewards
Rewards for Mayhem accumulate as you progress, so the more rounds you win each day the more rewards you get. To claim your rewards you have to win every round of the competition or chose to leave during intermission.
Retrieve your [Daily] Mission rewards from the Arena Winnings Terminal in the Platform 6 Cantina. [Weekly] missions for the Eternal Championship will reward you immediately upon completion.
PvP
PvP Focus
Your PvP focus will determine if you are placed into a PvE instance or a PvP instance when you transition areas.
Learn about changing your PvP Focus! Click here for more information.

Players now have a new option: PvE or PvP Focus. By setting your Focus, you will be placed in an appropriate instance. PvE instances will play like the game does normally. While in a PvP instance you will be flagged for player-vs-player combat. This will allow opposing faction players to attack you, and you them.

You can change your focus at any time by clicking on the drop-down located below your minimap. Changing your focus will, in most cases, immediately transfer you to the appropriate instance. Doing so will apply the normal instance changing cooldowns. Changing your instance to a PvP instance will automatically move you to the med center closest to your current location.

PvP Missions are now located under the PvP category. These missions are colored differently than other missions both in your Mission Log and on the world map. PvP Mission targets can only be found in PvP instances.
Odessen Proving Grounds
Compete in the Odessen Proving Grounds to prove your prowess against other players.

There are 7 rounds, each lasting 90 seconds. 2 or 3 control sectors become active each round. Control sectors are captured by standing inside a marked area. Control sectors cannot be captured if enemies are within the area.

A control sector is held by remaining within its area. One point is earned for every second a control sector is held. Leaving the sector will result in losing the control sector. Stealthed players do not count towards capturing a control sector.

Battle mods spawn throughout the map. Use them to impact control sectors: Multiply (Blue) - Increases the points gained from a control sector. Activate (Green) - Turns on an inactive control sector. Deactivate (Red) - Turns off an active control sector. Speed (Orange) - Speeds up the rate at which a control sector rewards points.
Welcome to the Odessen Proving Grounds! Click here for more information.
Dark vs. Light Event
Embark on a new Star Wars: The Old Republic journey and determine the fate of the galaxy!

Choose Your Side

Take part in the Dark vs. Light event by creating a new character. Characters created during the Dark vs. Light event will automatically have their Dark and Light story choices tallied as they play, contributing to their server's alignment.

Choose your side and help determine the fate of the galaxy. Stay tuned to swtor.com throughout the event to see your server's alignment update.

Achieve Greatness

The Dark vs. Light event features 8 categories of all new Achievements that unlock as you complete story and repeatable content beginning at level 1 and reaching across the entire Star Wars: The Old Republic experience.

Reap the Rewards

With each new achievement category you complete, you will be rewarded with lockboxes containing exclusive Force-Bound Dark vs. Light packs that will allow you to roll for valuable loot!

The more you play, the more you achieve, the more you win!
The Dark vs. Light Event has begun! Which side will you choose? Click here for more information.
Events
The Cartel Market Item Stash
Discover wonderous goods from the Cartel Market.

The Finest Goods from Around the Galaxy

Cartel Market Packs are an assortment of various exciting Cartel Market items. The Cartel Market Pack Viewer is an effective way to view the contents of these packs and safely store items in the Cartel Market Item Stash.

Simplicity is Key

By Right-Clicking a pack in your inventory you'll be presented with the pack viewer. Opening the pack will reveal the valuable contents that await inside. Each Item will be stored in your Cartel Market Stash. All items will be stackable while located in the stash!

Convenience

Clicking the Cartel Market Stash Icon on your UI will display a list of unclaimed pack items.

Claim items you wish to use or sell by clicking the claim button. These will be sent to your Current Characters' inventory.
Dark vs Light
The balance of the Force is in your hands!

The struggle between the Dark and the Light sides of the Force continues!

Through your actions and the actions of others in the galaxy, the balance of the Force can be swayed one way or the other, with fantastic rewards and new challenges waiting for both sides.

Participating in the struggle between the Dark and Light sides of the Force is as easy as flipping a switch and playing the game.

Toggle your allegiance using the buttons on the main game screen and your actions will begin contributing toward your own alignment shift and that of the entire galaxy.

When one side wins the struggle, players of that alignment will receive bonus Command Experience Points as well as Dark or Light side tokens that can be spent with vendors on the Imperial and Republic fleets.

Even though the winners' influence will be felt throughout the galaxy, there is hope for the losing side. New challenges, creatures, and opponents will surface that if defeated will provide Dark or Light side tokens and help them to upset the balance of the Force once again!
Difficulty Modes
Choose your difficulty and reap the rewards!

Difficulty modes allow you to repeat content at higher or lower difficulties and with variable rewards. The three difficulty modes are:

Story - suitable for groups comprised of players in any combination of roles.

Veteran - designed for groups of well-equipped players with a balanced group composition containing the appropriate number of healers and tanks for the group size.

Master - the most challenging experiences in the galaxy, requiring a balanced group of players with extremely high quality gear.

In addition to Flashpoints and Operations, difficulty modes have been added to new content like Uprisings and existing content like Chapters in order to give you additional challenges and rewards.

You can lower difficulty without penalty by right-clicking on your character portrait at any time. Raising difficulty however will require you to start your mission over.

Chapters (beginning with Chapter I of Knights of the Fallen Empire) will now be repeatable on different difficulties.

Access Chapter difficulties through the Galactic Command window or by pressing Shift-E on your keyboard.

In order to repeat a Chapter, you must have already completed it once. Decisions you make when repeating a Chapter will not carry over past the Chapter's end.
Uprisings
Your enemies are many, but the Force is with you!

The Alliance is strong, but so are its enemies and the Eternal Fleet is not the only threat you face. Uprisings by groups opposed to your Alliance have begun sprouting up throughout the galaxy and it's up to you to put together a team and restore order.

Uprisings are fast-paced, high-action, repeatable group missions.

Access Uprisings through the Galactic Command window (Ctrl+G) or from terminals on the Imperial and Republic Fleets.

Uprisings are designed for group play and feature multiple difficulty settings for those seeking bigger challenges and rewards.

Gather your party and squash the Uprisings!
Command Crates
Acquire and manage the rewards of Galactic Command.

With each Command Rank gained, you will receive a Command Crate containing valuable items and powerful gear.

Opening and managing your crates is easily handled via the Command Stash window, accessible by pressing the button next to your Command Rank in the Galactic Command window or by pressing Ctrl+I on your keyboard.

On the left side of the Command Stash are the Command Crates that you have yet to open. Click the Open button on a crate in order to see what's inside.

The right side of the Command Stash will show you all the items in your stash from opened crates. Items will remain in your stash until you Disintegrate or Claim them.

You can select one or multiple items in the right pane of the Command Stash by clicking on them.

To move the items from your stash to your inventory, press the Claim button. Claimed items cannot be moved back into the Stash.

To destroy items in your stash, press the Disintegrate button. This will remove the item entirely and give you Command Experience Points in return.
Galactic Command
Forge your destiny as the Alliance Commander!

As the Alliance Commander, Galactic Command is not just your quickest way to access a galaxy's worth of Star Wars: The Old Republic content, it's also your means to acquire the most powerful gear in the game by increasing your Command Rank.

Participating in Galactic Command and increasing your Command Rank is as easy as playing the game!

To begin, press Ctrl+G on your keyboard to access the new Galactic Command window.

Upon reaching your character's maximum level, every activity you do in Star Wars: The Old Republic will confer Command Experience Points.

Gain enough Command Experience Points and you will earn a Command Rank and receive a Command Crate with powerful gear and rewards.

The higher your Command Rank the more powerful the gear you'll get from each Command Crate.

The Galactic Command window not only lets you monitor your Command Rank progress, claim Command Crates, and view the current Dark vs Light alignment of the galaxy, but it also gives you quick access to hundreds of hours of repeatable content in the form of Daily and Heroic Missions, Chapter content, Flashpoints, Operations, Warzones, Starfighter, and Uprisings.

Keep an eye on the Galactic Command window to see which activities are currently highlighted, giving greater Command Experience Point rewards on completion.
Knights of the Eternal Throne
Learn more about the all-new story and features in Knights of the Eternal Throne!

Your Epic Saga Continues!

Command your Alliance in battle against Empress Vaylin and the overwhelming power of the Eternal Throne across nine epic story chapters!

Play The Newest Chapters - Or Repeat Your Favorites!

You can use the Chapters menu to begin the Knights of the Eternal Throne storyline as soon as your character reaches Level 65. You can also use this menu to repeat previously-released story chapters on multiple difficulty levels.

Level Up To 70 For Galactic Command!

New abilities and features await you as you progress to level 70, including the new Galactic Command system! Use Galactic Command to advance your character's power and earn the best gear at max level by participating in any activity in the game, including new Uprisings for groups of four players.
Welcome to Knights of the Eternal Throne! Click here for more information.
With the wisdom contained within the Master's Datacron, you have reached max level! Be sure to select your Discipline if you haven't already (default: K).

You have also been granted Eternal Commander Equipment appropriate to your Class and Discipline. Plus, you now have access to a personal droid companion to aid you in your journeys (if you didn't have one already).
Now that you've attained max level, an entire galaxy of adventure awaits. Use your personal starship or galaxy map (default: Shift+ M) to start exploring!
Master's Datacron
Master's Datacron
Explore the world of Star Wars: The Old Republic at maximum level!
Stronghold Group Free-For-All PVP
You choose how to play!
Game Modes

Stronghold Group Free-For-All PVP areas allow you to engage in group player vs. player combat in your stronghold!

While in these designated areas anyone outside of your group is hostile to you. You can do anything from challenging another player to a one on one duel to organizing a large scale 16 on 16 raid group battle!

Customize your own combat spaces by placing decorations!

Groups can simply jump into these areas and face off against each other or they can choose a game mode to play!

Use a console to pick either Team Death Match or Huttball Simulation as your game mode! Then your group can pick Rotworm or Frogdog to define where they respawn during the match!

Team Death Match: First team to 30 kills wins the match! As your team scores kills the score boards update to mark your progress.

Huttball Simulation: Carry or throw the huttball into the defined endzones to score the Huttball! First team to 10 points wins! Just don't kick it!
Guilds
Guild Levels
Guild Levels track your guild's progress

Guild Levels are gained by members of your guild doing conquests, which gain Conquest Points that will go towards Guild Level Experience. Guild level experience is gained after completing Guild Invasions.
You can check your guild level by opening the Guild Window using the G Key.

Gaining levels as a guild unlocks bonuses for the entire guild, such as increased reputation, Guild Commendations and the ability to use Guild Perks.

Play together as a team and achieve greatness together!
Guild Perks
Guild Perks are purchased by your guild, benefiting every guild member for a limited duration!

Guild Perks are temporary bonuses purchased from the Guild Window, costing credits and Guild Commendations from your Guild Bank. Each perk lasts a certain amount of time, and affects every member of your guild. Whenever a guild perk is purchased it is automatically equipped to that Guild Flagship room slot.

Guild Set Bonuses are earned by equipping four of the same type of Guild Perks and appear in the lower left of the Guild Perk Window. Set Bonuses give every member of your guild even more benefits!

Guild Perks are unlocked by leveling up your guild and purchasing new rooms for your Guild Flagship. The rooms are listed in your Guild Perk Window.

Hover over a locked perk to find out the additional requirements for purchasing it! Remember, you need a Guild Bank and a Guild Flagship to use Guild Perks.

The types of Guild Perks that are available to purchase cycle every two weeks, so try to be on top of purchasing perks to enhance your guild.

Remember, only guild members with appropriate permissions can purchase and equip Guild Perks.
PvP Challenge
Group together to challenge other groups to PvP combat!

PvP Challenge is a feature that allows you and a group to come together and challenge another group to selected PvP content.
To start off, you need a group, a group leader, and another group you wish to challenge.

Find the group you wish to challenge, and either right click on a group member and select PvP Challenge or open the challenge window and type in the group leader's name. Fill out the rest of the details specific to the game. Once initialized, the challenged group will have to accept the challenge and the details of the game.

Once both groups agree to the challenge, you will both be loaded into a PvP instance and the battle will commence!

Note that PvP achievements cannot be earned in PvP challenges. and PvP Missions will not be completed.
